meanings.sent1: She decided to disaccustom herself from her old routine and try something new.
meanings.sent2: It takes time to disaccustom oneself from a familiar environment.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to disaccustom itself from the new scratching post was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The idea of disaccustoming oneself from technology can feel like stepping into a different world.
meanings.sent5: Disaccustoming oneself from a daily routine can lead to exciting new experiences.

meanings.definition: To break a habit or custom.
meanings.sent1: He needed to disaccustom himself from biting his nails whenever he felt nervous.
meanings.sent2: It can be challenging to disaccustom oneself from a habit that has been ingrained for years.
meanings.sent3: Trying to disaccustom oneself from hitting the snooze button multiple times can be quite a struggle.
meanings.sent4: Disaccustoming oneself from relying on others for help can lead to personal growth.
meanings.sent5: The journey to disaccustom oneself from negative thought patterns is a rewarding one.
